# Task

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".



# Data

clean_column("My Column")

You can solve this problem using the built-in functions `lowercase`, `strip` and `replace`. Here is an example of how you might write such a function in Julia:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return replace(replace(lowercase(col), " " => "_"), "-" => "_")
end
```
This function first converts the column name to lower case, then replaces all spaces with underscores and finally hyphens with underscores. 

If you run `clean_column("My Column")` this will return `"my_column"`.
